messages.content: Hello, In this part of the interview process we will start with your resume round. Are you ready?
Yes let's start
Can you introduce yourself?
Yes, sure.
Go ahead.
I am Yashraj. I am an economics and Computer Science student. I live in Mumbai and have interests in finance and data science.
Good to know that, Yashraj.I could not find any project in your resume. Moving on to the next question. Could you tell me more aboue your experience at Young Minds Technology Solutions?
Can I get a hint?
You will get no hints for non skills based questions.
Idiot bot.
This may carry a negative impression in the evaluation.
My bad.
Please continue.
I worked there as a data science intern.
Could you elaborate more on this?
Let me think about it.
Sure, take your time.
Can I get a hint?
You will get no hints for non skills based questions.
So, I worked there as a data science intern.
Could you elaborate more on this?
My responsibilities included analyzing data from their products and performing EDA and other ML technqiues on them.
Nice, Yashraj, What ML techniques did you use while working at Young Minds Technology Solutions?
Can I get a hint?
You will get no hints for non skills based questions.
Okay. So I used ML algorithms like Clustering, Polynomial Regression, Decision Tress, Random Forest, K Nearest Neigbours and some more.
Great, Yashraj. Moving on to the next question. I can see that you've mentioned Machine Learning as your skill. Could you tell me more about it?
What points should I cover in my answer?
You could talk about what projects you've used it in, and your proficiency in it.
Makes sense.
Please continue.
I don't have any projects as such.
Please stay focused on the interview.
sure.
Moving on to the next question. What is the difference between Decision Tree and Random Forest?
I don't know
Shall we move ahead?
Idk
You could answer this question or move ahead.
Idk
As I didn't find any suitable response from you, moving on to the next question. What is boosting?
No clue.
Shall we move ahead?
I understand.
Okay, Yashraj. Moving on to the next question. I can see that you've mentioned Linux Operating System as your skill. Could you tell me more about it?
I understand.
Go ahead.
I have used it in my CS course subject Operating Systems.
Could you elaborate more on this?
No, nothing more to add.
Please stay focused on the interview.
hmm.
Okay, Yashraj. What is a kernel?
Could you reschedule this interview?
This interview can only be rescheduled once if you currently aren't retaking it.You have an option to continue this round later. Do you want to exit?
No
Please continue with previous question - What is a kernel?
Can I get a hint?
Sure, It is core component of an operating system
Can I get a hint?
You have been provided with the maximum number of hints for this question.
Kernel is central component of an operating system that manages operations of computer and hardware. It basically manages operations of memory and CPU time.
Correct, Yashraj. What is Monolithic Kernel?
Let's skip to the next question.
Okay, Yashraj.Thank you for your time. You can click on exit to leave this interview. We will get back to you soon.
